solution_line_template: If there are {humans_per_beaver} humans for every one beaver, then there are {total_humans_millions} million/{humans_per_beaver}=<<{total_humans_millions}/{humans_per_beaver}={beavers_millions}>>{beavers_millions} million beavers in Canada.

And if for every one moose there are two beavers, then the moose population of Canada is {beavers_millions} million/{beavers_per_moose}=<<{beavers_millions}/{beavers_per_moose}={moose_millions}>>{moose_millions} million.
